H0.text: Niels Bohr is the first person to introduce the idea that the continents move around the surface of Earth.

H1.text: Albert Einstein is the first person to introduce the idea of the continents moving around the surface of Earth.

H2.text: Charles Darwin was the first person to introduce the idea of the continents moving around the surface of Earth.

H3.text: Alfred Wegener was the first person to introduce the idea of the continents moving around the surface of Earth.

A4.text: Alfred Lothar Wegener was the originator of the continental drift hypothesis by suggesting in 1912 that the continents are slowly drifting around the Earth.

A5.text: He presented his continental drift hypothesis on 6 January 1912.
